newsitem.title: USA: American Telesource agrees to buy Computel.
newsitem.headline: American Telesource agrees to buy Computel.

text.p: American Telesource International Inc said Wednesday it has agreed to buy all of Mexican public telephone company Sistema de Telefon Computarizada SA de CV (Computel).
The privately held company, which acquired 55 percent of the shares of Computel as of May 1, said it expected to exercise its right to buy the remaining portion by July 31.
Computel, based in Guadalajara, Mexico, owns and operates public telephones in 70 Mexican cities and has revenues of about $6 million a year.
American TeleSource provides networks for voice and data and domestic and international long-distance services.
